briefTitle: Comparison of Psychotherapy Programs to Treat Panic Disorder

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Meets DSM-IV diagnosis criteria for primary PD with or without agoraphobia
* History of at least one spontaneous panic attack per week within the month prior to study entry

Exclusion Criteria:

* Active substance dependence within 6 months prior to study entry
* Lifetime history of any psychotic disorder, including bipolar disorder
* Acutely suicidal

outcomeMeasures.title: Panic Disorder Severity Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: A composite score of panic severity. High value = 28, lowest value =0. Higher=worse

outcomeMeasures.title: Sheehan Disability Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Level of psychosocial functional impairment. highest value=30, lowest value =0, higher numbers indicate greater dysfunction

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinical Global Impressions Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Clinical assessment of severity of impairment. Minimum value=1, maximum value =6; high scores worse

outcomeMeasures.title: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Level of state depression. scale 0-81, 0 symptom free, 81 worst severity

outcomeMeasures.title: Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: level of state anxiety. 0=symptom free, 56 most severe

outcomeMeasures.title: Anxiety Disorder Sensitivity Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Anxiety disorder sensitivity index measures Sensitivity to physical symptoms of anxiety (scores range from 0-64). 0= no anxiety, 64 =maximum anxiety

outcomeMeasures.title: Brief Body Sensitivity Interpretation Questionnaire (BBSIQ)
outcomeMeasures.description: The BBSIQ measures how physically sensitive the person is to physical symptoms of anxiety; (scores range 0-63) 0= no anxiety; 63= highest levels of physical anxiety

outcomeMeasures.title: Panic-Specific Reflective Function
outcomeMeasures.description: Ability to reflect on the emotional meaning of panic symptoms. scored -1 to 9, high numbers better
